page.title:
Liability Under CFCA Fraudulent acts under the CFCA:
Liability Under CFCA
Fraudulent acts under the CFCA:
page.normal_text:
Knowingly “presents or causes to be presented” a false claim to the state. Knowingly makes, uses, or causes to be made or used a false record or statement to get a false claim paid or approved. Conspiring to defraud the state by submitting a false claim or be paid one. Delivering less property to the state than stated in the receipt. Falsifying a receipt for state property. Knowingly buying or taking a pledge of public property from another not authorized to sell or pledge the property. Knowingly benefitting from a false claim to the state. Benefits from an inadvertent submission of a false claim and fails to disclose the false claim within a reasonable time after discovery.

picture.name: Image522

page.title:
Whistleblower Protections
Whistleblower Protections
page.normal_text:
This section protects employees against discharge, demotion, suspension, threats, harassment, or discrimination by the employer because of lawful acts done by the employee in cooperating with the False Claims Act.
This section protects employees against T h i s

page.title:
Billions of $$$ are lost to Fraud
Billions of $$$ are lost to Fraud
page.normal_text:
It is estimated that 5% of total U.S. health care funds are lost to fraud! “During FY 2006, the Federal Government won or negotiated approximately $2.2 billion in judgments and settlements, and it attained additional administrative impositions in health care fraud cases and proceedings. The HCFAC account has returned over $10.4 billion to the Medicare Trust Fund since the inception of the program in 1997”. Healthcare Fraud and Abuse Control Program 2006
It is estimated that 5% of total U.S. health care funds are lost
to fraud!

Healthcare Fraud and Abuse Control Program 2006

page.title:
So Now You Know
So Now You Know
page.enlisting:
◼ You can help protect government funds by reporting any suspected fraud, waste, or abuse.
